result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 10:33 am
INCLUDES 22CF426, 22CF708, 22CM123, 22CM124.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julianne Lennon in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CF426:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.

22CF708:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 >> Delete 'Repeater' Enhancer.
Ct. 6 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 7 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 8 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 9 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.

22CM123:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500))>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CF708:
Ct. 5 (Theft-Movable Property <$2500)>> NO CONTEST.

22CM124:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500))>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF708:
Ct. 5 (Theft-Movable Property <$2500)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant is eligible for expungement upon completion of probation. Court finds 43 days credit.

22CM124:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500))>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. No Contact with the Kwik Trips in Wausau. Defendant is eligible for expungement upon completion of probation. Court finds 43 days credit.

Adjourned: 10:51 am
Signed at MCJ on 7/28/22
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:20 am.

INCLUDES 22CF708, 22CF426, 22CM123, 22CM124.  No contact with victim(s):  J.D.P. or H.M.G. (witness) and victim, Kwik Trip.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
